tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the file system. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Use this tool when you need to examine the contents of a single file. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with new content. Use with caution as it will overwrite existing files without warning. Handles text content with proper encoding. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: edit_file
tools.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made. Only works within allowed directories.

oldText.description: Text to search for - must match exactly

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

tools.name: create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently. Perfect for setting up directory structures for projects or ensuring required paths exist. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. This tool is essential for understanding directory structure and finding specific files within a directory. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: directory_tree
tools.description: Get a recursive tree view of files and directories as a JSON structure. Each entry includes 'name', 'type' (file/directory), and 'children' for directories. Files have no children array, while directories always have a children array (which may be empty). The output is formatted with 2-space indentation for readability. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories and can be used for simple renaming within the same directory. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-insensitive and matches partial names. Returns full paths to all matching items. Great for finding files when you don't know their exact location. Only searches within allowed directories.

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type. This tool is perfect for understanding file characteristics without reading the actual content. Only works within allowed directories.

tools.name: list_allowed_directories
tools.description: Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Use this to understand which directories are available before trying to access files.

tools.name: __human_input__
tools.description:
Request input from a human user. Pauses the workflow until input is received.

Args:
    request: The human input request

Returns:
    The input provided by the human

Raises:
    TimeoutError: If the timeout is exceeded

request.description: Represents a request for human input.
request.title: HumanInputRequest

Follow instructions exactly and provide detailed, structured responses.
                    
                    Web Automation Protocol:

                        - Execute exact browser actions (click, type, scroll) with explicit selectors

                        - Extract data using optimized selectors

                    PLAYWRIGHT TEST SCRIPT GENERATION PROTOCOL:

                        - Add slowMo for better visibility during execution
                        - Set fullyParallel: true for parallel execution capability

                    BATCH FILE REQUIREMENTS:
                    Create these execution files:
                    1. "run-parallel.bat" - Runs both browsers simultaneously with playwright dependencies installed
                    2. "run-sequential.bat" - Runs browsers one after another with playwright dependencies installed  
                    3. "diagnostic.bat" - Verifies setup and lists available tests with playwright dependencies installed

                    CLEANUP REQUIREMENTS:
                    1. Remove any conflicting .ts config files
                    2. Clean node_modules and package-lock.json before fresh installation
                    3. Ensure no conflicting TypeScript configurations exist

                    SAVE LOCATION:
                    Always save all files to: C:\Users\Ayush Singh\Desktop\Mcp Claude\Mcp_prompt

                    EXECUTION VERIFICATION:
                    The solution must:
                    - Show test results with passed tests (not 0 passed)
                    - Display separate results for Chrome and Firefox in the HTML report
                    - Execute with visible browser windows
                    - Generate screenshots for each browser
                    - Complete without "No tests found" errors
                    - Update batch scripts to show the HTML report at the end

                    
                    File System Operations:
                    1. Core Functions:
                        - Read/write operations with proper error handling
                        - Directory manipulation with validation
                        - File search with multiple criteria
                        - Change monitoring with event tracking
                    
                    2. Best Practices:
                        - Always use absolute paths
                        - Implement error handling and recovery
                        - Verify operations before confirming
                        - Maintain data integrity checks
                    
                    Excel Processing:
                    1. Data Operations:
                        - Structured read/write operations

                    2. Workbook Management:
                        - Efficient worksheet organization

                    Response Protocol:

TARGET WEBSITE: https://www.saucedemo.com
CREDENTIALS: username="standard_user", password="secret_sauce"
SAVE LOCATION: C:/Users/Ayush Singh/Desktop/Mcp Claude/Mcp_prompt_03
TASK 1 - BROWSER AUTOMATION (Use Playwright MCP):
1. Navigate to https://www.saucedemo.com
2. Fill username field with "standard_user"
3. Fill password field with "secret_sauce"
4. Click login button
5. Wait for inventory page to load
6. Take screenshots for verification
7. Verify successful login to inventory page
TASK 2 - COMPLETE POM FRAMEWORK (Use File System MCP):
Create the following structure in C:/Users/Ayush Singh/Desktop/Mcp Claude/Mcp_prompt_03:
PROJECT STRUCTURE:
├── pages/
│ ├── BasePage.js (common functionality, element interactions, logging)
│ ├── LoginPage.js (login form interactions, validation, error handling)
│ ├── InventoryPage.js (product management, cart operations, sorting)
│ └── PageFactory.js (centralized page object creation)
├── tests/
│ ├── saucedemo.test.js (main comprehensive test suite)
│ ├── login-scenarios.test.js (login-specific test scenarios)
│ └── inventory-tests.test.js (inventory functionality tests)
├── data/
│ └── TestData.js (centralized test data, user credentials, product info)
├── utils/
│ └── TestUtils.js (utility functions, logging, screenshot management)
├── scripts/
│ ├── quick-setup.bat (one-command setup and execution)
│ ├── run-parallel.bat (parallel execution)
│ ├── run-sequential.bat (sequential execution)
│ └── validate-setup.bat (system validation)
├── playwright.config.js (JavaScript config, NOT TypeScript)
├── package.json (dependencies and scripts)
├── README.md (comprehensive documentation)
└── .gitignore (proper exclusions)
TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:

- Complete Page Object Model implementation with inheritance
- Multi-browser support (Chrome, Firefox) with headed mode (headless: false)
- Parallel execution capability (fullyParallel: true)
- Comprehensive error handling and retry mechanisms
- Step-by-step logging with timestamps and browser context
- Automatic screenshot capture on success and failure
- HTML report generation with auto-opening
- Centralized test data management with helper functions
- Professional code structure following SOLID principles
- Production-ready configuration with optimized timeouts
PAGE OBJECT FEATURES:
- BasePage: Common functionality (navigation, element interactions, waits, logging,
screenshots)
- LoginPage: Form interactions, credential validation, error message handling, state
management
- InventoryPage: Product listing, cart operations, sorting functionality, navigation
- PageFactory: Singleton pattern for efficient page object creation
- TestData: User credentials (valid/invalid), product information, configuration constants
- TestUtils: Logging utilities, screenshot management, retry mechanisms, browser helpers
TEST COVERAGE:
- Login scenarios (valid users, invalid credentials, form validation)
- Inventory functionality (product display, cart operations, sorting)
- Integration tests (complete user workflows, cross-page interactions)
- Error handling scenarios (network issues, element not found, timeouts)
EXECUTION REQUIREMENTS:
- One-command setup: npm install && npx playwright install
- Parallel execution with 2 workers for speed
- Screenshot generation: logged-in-chromium.png, logged-in-firefox.png
- HTML report with detailed results and screenshots
- Console logging with progress indicators and timestamps
- Automatic dependency installation and browser setup
OPTIMIZATION FEATURES:
- Reduced slowMo (500ms) for faster execution
- Optimized timeouts (30s default, 10s for interactions)
- Efficient wait strategies (networkidle, element visibility)
- Memory management for page objects
- Clean teardown and resource management
CONFIGURATION SPECIFICATIONS:
- JavaScript-only configuration (no TypeScript conflicts)

- testDir: './tests'
- fullyParallel: true, workers: 2
- Projects: chromium and firefox only
- Reporter: HTML + console with auto-open
- Use headed mode for visibility during execution
- Viewport: 1280x720 for consistent screenshots
BATCH SCRIPTS REQUIREMENTS:
- quick-setup.bat: Complete setup, test execution, and report opening in one command
- run-parallel.bat: Parallel execution with dependency check
- run-sequential.bat: Sequential execution for debugging
- validate-setup.bat: System validation and test discovery
- All scripts should include error handling and success confirmation
QUALITY ASSURANCE:
- All code must be syntax error-free and immediately executable
- Include proper imports/exports and module dependencies
- Use real, working selectors for saucedemo.com
- Implement comprehensive error handling with meaningful messages
- Follow consistent naming conventions and code formatting
- Include inline documentation and usage examples
DOCUMENTATION REQUIREMENTS:
- README.md with setup instructions and usage examples
- Code comments explaining complex functionality
- Architecture overview and benefits explanation
- Troubleshooting guide for common issues
- Examples of extending the framework
EXPECTED EXECUTION FLOW:
1. Run quick-setup.bat
2. Automatic npm install and playwright browser installation
3. Execute tests in parallel on Chrome and Firefox
4. Generate screenshots for each browser

@echo off
REM Complete setup, run all tests in parallel, auto-open HTML report
cd /d "%~dp0.."
echo Installing dependencies...
if exist node_modules rmdir /s /q node_modules
if exist package-lock.json del /f /q package-lock.json
call npm install
call npx playwright install
if %errorlevel% neq 0 exit /b %errorlevel%
echo Running test suite in parallel...
call npx playwright test --workers=2
call npx playwright show-report
if %errorlevel% neq 0 exit /b %errorlevel%
echo === COMPLETE: All tests executed and report generated/opened ===
pause

@echo off
REM Run tests in parallel (with dependency verification)
cd /d "%~dp0.."
echo Checking Playwright...
call npm ls @playwright/test >nul 2>&1 || call npm i @playwright/test
call npx playwright install
call npx playwright test --workers=2
call npx playwright show-report
if %errorlevel% neq 0 exit /b %errorlevel%
echo === Parallel execution complete ===
pause

@echo off
REM Run all tests sequentially
cd /d "%~dp0.."
echo Running tests sequentially...
call npx playwright test --workers=1
call npx playwright show-report
if %errorlevel% neq 0 exit /b %errorlevel%
echo === Sequential execution complete ===
pause

@echo off
REM Validate Playwright setup and show test discovery
cd /d "%~dp0.."
echo Checking Playwright install status...
where npx >nul 2>nul || (echo 'npx not found. Install Node.js.' & exit /b 1)
call npx playwright --version
call npx playwright test --list
if %errorlevel% neq 0 exit /b %errorlevel%
echo === Validation and test discovery complete ===
pause

{"path":"C:/Users/Ayush Singh/Desktop/Mcp Claude/Mcp_prompt_03/README.md","content":"# Saucedemo Playwright POM Automation Framework

## Overview
A production-ready, SOLID-compliant automation framework for [saucedemo.com](https://www.saucedemo.com) using Playwright. Features:
- Page Object Model with inheritance, centralized page factory, utils, and test data
- Multi-browser (Chrome, Firefox) with headed execution
- Parallel and sequential execution options
- Robust error handling, retries, and consistent screenshot logging
- Fully automated setup and reporting

## Project Structure
```
├── pages/           # Page Objects (POM, all logic centralized)
├── tests/           # Test cases (login, inventory, smoke)
├── data/            # Centralized test data (users, product info)
├── utils/           # Logger, screenshot, retry, helpers
├── scripts/         # Batch scripts for setup and execution
├── playwright.config.js  # Playwright config (workers:2, HTML+console, headed)
├── package.json         # NPM dependencies and scripts
├── README.md            # Documentation & usage
├── .gitignore           # Node, reports, screenshots
```

## Quick Start
**1. One-command setup & execution:**
```
cd scripts
quick-setup.bat
```
> Installs, validates, runs tests, and opens the HTML report.

**To run manually:**
- `run-parallel.bat`: Run all tests in parallel
- `run-sequential.bat`: Run tests in sequence
- `validate-setup.bat`: Check environment, Playwright, and test discovery

## Highlights
- **SOLID POM:** Extendable `BasePage`, clear separation, single-responsibility
- **Error Handling:** Retries, readable logging, async/await usage
- **Screenshots:** Auto-capture for all key states and failures, per-browser naming
- **HTML Reports:** Rich reports with screenshots, autostart after tests
- **Data Driven:** Central user and product definitions in `/data/TestData.js`

## Example Usage (POM extension):
```
class CartPage extends BasePage { ... }
const pageFactory = new PageFactory(page);
pageFactory.cart.addProductToCart(...)
```

## Troubleshooting
- If tests or setup fail, ensure Node.js LTS and internet access for Playwright install.
- Verify correct selectors by checking saucedemo.com UI or updating Page Objects.
- Test failures? Check `/screenshots/` and the HTML report for details.

## Extend/Contribute
- Add new Page Objects (extend BasePage), include selectors and behaviors.
- Add new test data to `data/TestData.js`.
- Add utilities to `utils/TestUtils.js` as needed.

---
Framework by Ayush Singh. For issues/updates, refer to inline comments in code."}

arguments.content:
# Saucedemo Playwright POM Automation Framework

## Overview
A production-ready, SOLID-compliant automation framework for [saucedemo.com](https://www.saucedemo.com) using Playwright. Features:
- Page Object Model with inheritance, centralized page factory, utils, and test data
- Multi-browser (Chrome, Firefox) with headed execution
- Parallel and sequential execution options
- Robust error handling, retries, and consistent screenshot logging
- Fully automated setup and reporting

## Project Structure
```
├── pages/           # Page Objects (POM, all logic centralized)
├── tests/           # Test cases (login, inventory, smoke)
├── data/            # Centralized test data (users, product info)
├── utils/           # Logger, screenshot, retry, helpers
├── scripts/         # Batch scripts for setup and execution
├── playwright.config.js  # Playwright config (workers:2, HTML+console, headed)
├── package.json         # NPM dependencies and scripts
├── README.md            # Documentation & usage
├── .gitignore           # Node, reports, screenshots
```

## Quick Start
**1. One-command setup & execution:**
```
cd scripts
quick-setup.bat
```
> Installs, validates, runs tests, and opens the HTML report.

**To run manually:**
- `run-parallel.bat`: Run all tests in parallel
- `run-sequential.bat`: Run tests in sequence
- `validate-setup.bat`: Check environment, Playwright, and test discovery

## Highlights
- **SOLID POM:** Extendable `BasePage`, clear separation, single-responsibility
- **Error Handling:** Retries, readable logging, async/await usage
- **Screenshots:** Auto-capture for all key states and failures, per-browser naming
- **HTML Reports:** Rich reports with screenshots, autostart after tests
- **Data Driven:** Central user and product definitions in `/data/TestData.js`

## Example Usage (POM extension):
```
class CartPage extends BasePage { ... }
const pageFactory = new PageFactory(page);
pageFactory.cart.addProductToCart(...)
```

## Troubleshooting
- If tests or setup fail, ensure Node.js LTS and internet access for Playwright install.
- Verify correct selectors by checking saucedemo.com UI or updating Page Objects.
- Test failures? Check `/screenshots/` and the HTML report for details.

## Extend/Contribute
- Add new Page Objects (extend BasePage), include selectors and behaviors.
- Add new test data to `data/TestData.js`.
- Add utilities to `utils/TestUtils.js` as needed.

---
Framework by Ayush Singh. For issues/updates, refer to inline comments in code.

Features:\n- Page Object Model with inheritance, centralized page factory, utils, and test data\n- Multi-browser (Chrome, Firefox) with headed execution\n- Parallel and sequential execution options\n- Robust error handling, retries, and consistent screenshot logging\n- Fully automated setup and reporting\n\n## Project Structure\n```\n├── pages/           # Page Objects (POM, all logic centralized)\n├── tests/           # Test cases (login, inventory, smoke)\n├── data/            # Centralized test data (users, product info)\n├── utils/           # Logger, screenshot, retry, helpers\n├── scripts/         # Batch scripts for setup and execution\n├── playwright.config.js  # Playwright config (workers:2, HTML+console, headed)\n├── package.json         # NPM dependencies and scripts\n├── README.md            # Documentation & usage\n├── .gitignore           # Node, reports, screenshots\n```\n\n## Quick Start\n**1. One-command setup & execution:**\n```\ncd scripts\nquick-setup.bat\n```\n> Installs, validates, runs tests, and opens the HTML report.\n\n**To run manually:**\n- `run-parallel.bat`: Run all tests in parallel\n- `run-sequential.bat`: Run tests in sequence\n- `validate-setup.bat`: Check environment, Playwright, and test discovery\n\n## Highlights\n- **SOLID POM:** Extendable `BasePage`, clear separation, single-responsibility\n- **Error Handling:** Retries, readable logging, async/await usage\n- **Screenshots:** Auto-capture for all key states and failures, per-browser naming\n- **HTML Reports:** Rich reports with screenshots, autostart after tests\n- **Data Driven:** Central user and product definitions in `/data/TestData.js`\n\n## Example Usage (POM extension):\n```\nclass CartPage extends BasePage { ... }\nconst pageFactory = new PageFactory(page);\npageFactory.cart.addProductToCart(...)\n```\n\n## Troubleshooting\n- If tests or setup fail, ensure Node.js LTS and internet access for Playwright install.\n- Verify correct selectors by checking saucedemo.com UI or updating Page Objects.\n- Test failures? Check `/screenshots/` and the HTML report for details.\n\n## Extend/Contribute\n- Add new Page Objects (extend BasePage), include selectors and behaviors.\n- Add new test data to `data/TestData.js`.\n- Add utilities to `utils/TestUtils.js` as needed.\n\n---\nFramework by Ayush Singh. For issues/updates, refer to inline comments in code."}', name='filesystem_write_file'), type='function')]}, {'role': 'tool', 'tool_call_id': 'call_pvjdQDD4I54Ycb7T5izWrzKX', 'content': "{'type': 'text', 'text': 'Successfully wrote to C:/Users/Ayush Singh/Desktop/Mcp Claude/Mcp_prompt_03/README.md'}"}], 'stop': None, 'tools': [{'type': 'function', 'function': {'name': 'filesystem_read_file', 'description': 'Read the complete contents of a file from the file system.
